ApplyConcurrent.document: This API is used to request concurrency quota.
ApplyConcurrent.name: Requests concurrency quota

CreateSession.document: This API is used to create a session.
CreateSession.name: Creates a session

DestroySession.document: This API is used to terminate a session.
DestroySession.name: Terminates a session

members.document: The user’s unique ID. Tencent Cloud does not parse the ID. You need to manage your own user IDs. Based on your needs, you can either define unique IDs for users or use timestamps to generate random IDs. Make sure the same ID is used when a user reconnects to your application.
members.name: UserId

members.document: Public IP of user’s application client, which is used for nearby scheduling.
members.name: UserIp

members.document: Application ID, which is used only by the multi-application project to specify applications. For a single-application project, this parameter is ignored, and the application bound to the project will be used.
members.name: ApplicationId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The user’s unique ID. Tencent Cloud does not parse the ID. You need to manage your own user IDs. Based on your needs, you can either define unique IDs for users or use timestamps to generate random IDs. Make sure the same ID is used when a user reconnects to your application.
members.name: UserId

members.document: Public IP of user’s application client, which is used for nearby scheduling.
members.name: UserIp

members.document: The client-side session data, which is obtained from the SDK.
members.name: ClientSession

members.document:
The on-cloud running mode.
`RunWithoutClient`: Keep the application running on the cloud even when there are no client connections.
Empty string (default): Keep the application running on the cloud only when there are client connections.
members.name: RunMode

members.document: The server-side session data, which is returned to the SDK.
members.name: ServerSession

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The user’s unique ID. Tencent Cloud does not parse the ID. You need to manage your own user IDs. Based on your needs, you can either define unique IDs for users or use timestamps to generate random IDs. Make sure the same ID is used when a user reconnects to your application.
members.name: UserId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId
